intro: Clavistylus peltatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved lily, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Liliaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and parts of Asia. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens. Clavistylus peltatus is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its historical use in traditional medicine.
